awd_abstract_narration: The University of Wisconsin at Superior will initiate a six-week,               residential Young Scholars program in Ecology for 20 students entering          grades 10,11.                                                                                                                                                   Through a series of classroom, field, and laboratory experiences                participants will become acquainted with the techniques used to monitor         the physical, chemical, and biological health of aquatic communities.           Students will also be introduced to the fields of environmental                 toxicology and bioremediation.  They will then be challenged to use             their knowledge to design and carry out a group assessment of portions          of the Lake Superior watershed.                                                                                                                                 The training that students receive in this program will enable them to          develop independent study projects which will be completed at their             local schools.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
